page.title: 07Road Development:Chatteris
page.content: The proposed Chatteris{bypass}will be part of the Fen Link strategy to improve roads in the area. (Improvements have already been made to the March and Huntingdon roads). The bypass will be a single carriageway two miles long, costing around{Â£1 million per mile,}passing to the east of the town. It is expected to carry a mixture of local and national freight traffic and will help to stimulate development and jobs. Local{opposition}has centred round the proposed route of the new road. This opposition comes from landowners who do not want to lose their land. Another difficulty is building the road on the soft Fen soil. Special drainage work is needed. The new road should take about 12 months to build and be ready in autumn{1987.}Central government and County Council pay.
